content.name: Control
content.description:
In this archetype you'll most likely want to take the role of the defender and 
      control the pace of the game. You will want to remove efficiently your opponent's 
      threats without taking too much damage in the early game and out-value them with 
      your big threats in the late-game. Some real deck examples are Control 
      warrior and Control priest.

content.name: Mid-Range
content.description:
A mid-range deck usually has as little early game as possible, mainly for defense 
      purposes. It develops threats in the mid-game and in the late-game tries to end the 
      game with burst, or by cycling through the deck for new threats, or by developing a 
      limited number of big threats. Some real deck examples are mid-range Hunter 
      and mid-range Paladin.

content.name: Aggro
content.description:
An aggro archetype favors early board development with high damage minions. 
      You'll most likely have the board in the early - mid game, so you can take some 
      efficient trades. Later you'll want to prioritize face damage because you want 
      to end the game quickly. You kill your opponent with minion damage 
      (if you still have a board) and most frequently with burst spells / weapons or 
      charge minions. Some real deck examples are Face Hunter, Aggro Paladin, 
      Backspace Rogue and some Zoolock Warlock variations.

content.name: Tempo
content.description:
A tempo deck emphasizes on using all the available mana every single turn. 
      You will want to develop early - mid game threats and clear your opponent's 
      minions with efficient removal mana wise(e.g Hex an Emperor Thaurissan. 
      You spent 4 mana for their 6 mana card). You finish the game with minion damage, 
      burn or by developing a big threat. Some real deck examples are Tempo mage and 
      Tempo Rogue.

content.name: Mill
content.description:
In a mill archetype your main focus is to destroy your opponent's cards by overdrawing 
      them. You' ll most likely deal the final blow by drawing them into fatigue.

content.name: Fatigue - Grinder
content.description:
This archetype is the epitome of a control deck. Your goal is to remove all 
      your opponent's threats efficiently (card advantage wise) and have the last 
      minion standing. You most often win with fatigue damage after a long game. 
      Some real deck examples are Fatigue mage, Warrior and Priest.

content.name: Flood
content.description:
A flood deck wants to flood the board with cheap and strong minions as soon as possible. 
      By having the board you can take efficient trades or play synergistic cards in the mid-game.
       Some real deck examples could be Zoolock Warlock and Flood mage.

content.name: Malorne
content.description: Pretty good stats for the mana cost and suitable for fatigue battles. An average card overall.

content.name: Kun
content.description: A 0 mana 7/7 or a insane combo enabler. A staple card in Druid for sure.

content.name: Deathknight
content.description: Why this Deathknight costs only 7 mana? One of the best Deathknight's for sure.

content.name: Ultimate Infestation
content.description: A card that changed the Druid class for the better. No i am just kidding, it made Druid unbearable. Expect a nerf sometime in the future?

content.name: Ixlid
content.description: The ability of this card seems insane. Can you find a deck to fit him in?

content.name: Twig
content.description:
Mainly a combo card that can lead you to explosive turns. It 
                    would be broken if it was a warrior card for example.

content.name: Cenarius
content.description: A slow, value that can end the game if you have the board. Most of the times, it will keep you alive and create a formidable board in the same time.

content.name: Grizzled Guardian
content.description:
A card that needs to be explored more. If the effect triggers and
                    you've built a deck around it, it's very good.

content.name: Dark Wispers
content.description: A weak card that is suited for token or buff decks.

content.name: Living Mana
content.description: A powerful card that fits well in token and aggro deck.

content.name: Fatespinner
content.description:
The "advantage" of this card is that your opponent does not
                    know the effect you chose. Sadly it's easy to guess.

content.name: Lotus Agents
content.description: A decent card that can fit in any deck due to the discover effect.

content.name: Branching Paths
content.description:
Flexible is the word that can describe best this card. You pay
                    a little more than the normal for flexibility.

content.name: Evolving Spores
content.description: A win more card (you have to have the board to be good) that fits well in token decks.

content.name: Tortollan Forager
content.description:
In first glance, it seems a very good card but most of the times
                    it is slow for 2 mana and the 5 attack minion doesn't always worth it.

content.name: Raven Idol
content.description: A flexible card that synergises well with cards that benefit from casting spells, like Arcane Giant.

content.name: Forbidden Ancient
content.description: A flexible but weak card that gives you a vanilla minion to fill your curve.

content.name: Tracking
content.description:
One of the most underappreciated cards in Hearthstone. This card is really good because in later turns you can get what you want from your deck and discard the cards
                    you don't want to draw.

content.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
content.description: One of the first experiments to make the Hunter class more control oriented. It turned out that the original 2 damage per turn to the face is too good.

content.name: Gahz'rilla
content.description: A win more card that can end the game quickly if the opponent doesn't remove it. Or of he leaves a Tundra Rhino alive...

content.name: Dreadscale - Acidmaw
content.description:
The Dreadscale is obviously the better card here but the Acidmaw can 
                    swing the game in your favor (by clearing the board) if you combo it.

content.name: Explorer's Hat
content.description: A slow value card for a control or fatigue hunter deck. Keep in mind that usually these kind of Hunter decks don't do well...

content.name: Desert Camel
content.description:
The ancestor of recruit cards. It is good in meta's without 
                    or weak 1 drops.

content.name: Giant Sand Worm
content.description:
It is a board clear and a threat altogether, 
                    if the opponent leaves it on the board.

content.name: Piranha Launcher
content.description:
A slow, value card that can generate value over time. Also synergizes
                    well with cards that require a beast on the board.

content.name: Dinomancy
content.description:
A card suited for slower, board centric Hunter decks. 
                    Is it really worth it to replace one of the best hero powers
                    in the game though?

content.name: Deathknight
content.description:
This card failed to make tier 1 Hunter decks but on the other hand
                    it is one the most fun cards in the game.

content.name: Call of the Wild
content.description:
A card that doesn't fit in competitive hunter decks but still it has a strong impact. It would be 
                    good for 1 less mana...

content.name: King Krush
content.description: This card has one of the best entrance animations in the game.

content.name: Kathrena Winterwisp
content.description:
A value card and a combo enabler. It's used mainly for it's synergy with
                    big charge minions and Carnivorous Cube

content.name: Swamp King Dred
content.description:
Good stats for the mana cost and an interesting effect. Sadly the are 
                    not many (any) control Hunter decks to make use of it.

content.name: Lesser Emerald Spellstone
content.description: Probably the best Hunter cards of the Kobolds and Catacombs expansion.

content.name: Knuckles
content.description: A minion that can trade and go face at the same time! Hunters have a reason to trade now.

content.name: Ram Wrangler
content.description: If you pull at least a 3 drop from the battlecry it is good. Generally minions that summon other minions do well in Hearthstone.

content.name: Tundra Rhino
content.description:
Tundra Rhino is one card that was never overpowered but always
                    finds its way in relevant Hunter decks. I think this is a sign of good
                    game design. FeelsGoodMan

content.name: Cave Hydra
content.description:
A card that your opponent will try to remove. The 2 attack makes it easy for your opponent to trade with minions (they don't usually die).
                    If you manage to attack with it you'll get some sweet value.

content.name: Cloaked Huntress
content.description: Really good stats for the cost and a card with an insane synergy with secrets.

content.name: Stitched Tracker
content.description: A value card that can create an infinite loop of discoveries. Despite being a value card, it's not so slow as it seems.

content.name: Candleshot
content.description: As it turns out it's good to be able to deal 1 damage (basically for free, you pay 1 mana for 3 attacks) and not take damage. Good for early game, useful for late game also.

content.name: Polymorphs
content.description: Nice deathrattle card you got there!

content.name: Flame Leviathan
content.description: A control card that is included mostly in meme decks. Congrats sir, you've got yourself a meme deck.

content.name: Antonidas
content.description:
A staple card for mage decks. It is an exodia piece in some decks
                    and a card that must be removed at all costs in others.

content.name: Rhonin
content.description: A slow card that fits well in decks that make use of small spells.

content.name: Deathknight
content.description: The goal with this card according to Thijs (ties) is to make a water elemental every turn. A really powerful standalone card.

content.name: Aluneth
content.description:
A double edged sword that is used mainly in aggresive or tempo decks. If you don't
                    end the game quickly you may lose to fatigue. It's not weak to weapon removal because it draws you 3 cards right away.

content.name: Deck of Wonders
content.description: Are you ready for some memes?

content.name: Pyroblast
content.description: Imagine how good that card would be for 8 mana. Oh wait...

content.name: Sindragosa
content.description:
A slow, value card that synergizes well with Frost Lich Jaina or just
                    with the mage hero power.

content.name: Firelands Portal
content.description: One the best (most annoying) cards in the game. A card that removes a threat (or goes to the face for 5) and develops your board at the same time.

content.name: Faceless Summoner
content.description: A card that can quickly develop your board if you have overstated 3 drops.

content.name: Cabalist's Tome
content.description: A decent value card but with random outcomes.

content.name: Ethereal Conjurer
content.description:
Ethereal Conjurer has an aggresive statline but due to the discover 
                    effect can fit in many decks.

content.name: Flamewaker
content.description:
A staple card in tempo mage that can cause a lot of damage if
                    you plan it correctly.

content.name: Kabal Courier
content.description: Kabal Courier has a weak statline but it's battlecry is powerful because it lets you choose cards not designed for your class. It's also a discover effect meaning that you can choose what you need most, at the time.

content.name: Spellslinger
content.description:
An aggresive card used in tempo mage decks. If the spell generation has more
                    value to you than your opponent, it is good.

content.name: Pyros
content.description:
Pyros is a value card that has decent stats (in all of its forms) for the mana cost.

content.name: Shifting Scroll
content.description:
The first time you get a spell that is somehow relevant to the situation,

content.description:
Sword of Justice has good synergy with minion heavy decks. It is more

content.name: Blessing of Wisdom
content.description:
A flexible card that can reduce the damage from an enemy threat (your opponent will avoid attacking) or make

content.name: Divine Favor
content.description:
One could say that divine favor is an example of bad card design. It punishes

content.name: Cobalt Guardian
content.description: A bad card that can only be used in a mech deck.

content.name: Murloc Knight
content.description:
Murloc Knight is a good standalone card can snowball the game 
                    in your favor if not removed.

content.name: Enter the Coliseum
content.description: This card in most situations is a bad brawl.

content.name: Eadric the Pure
content.description:
Eadric is a good control card that can neutralize your opponents minion damage and 
                    buy you some extra time.

content.name: Tirion Fordring
content.description:
Tirion is one of the best legendaries from the start of the game until
                    now.

content.description:
The paladin deathknight can be used in one turn kill decks with Auctionmaster Beardo or be

content.name: Val'anyr
content.description:
Val'anyr is a value card that can be really good if you can manage to land

content.name: Ragnaros, Lightlord

content.name: Vinecleaver

content.name: Keeper of Uldaman

Insane card that serves multiple roles and can

content.name: Coghammer
content.description:
A flexible card and maybe one of the best

content.name: Unidentified Maul
content.description:
Seriously the only mediocre outcome of this card's effect is taunt. Really good weapon especially
                    in fast decks.

content.name: Wickerflame Burnbristle
content.description: A decent minion that begs for buffs.

content.name: A Light in the Darkness

content.name: Health Swap
content.description: Ok those cards can be useful in some situations but i added this flavor for the memes.

content.description: It is way worse than Raza + Anduin combo even after the Raza nerf.

content.name: Velen
content.description:
Mainly used to kill your oppoenent in one turn but can be a defensive

content.name: Shadowfiend
content.description:
You can get some sweet tempo plays if it sticks on the board or if you
                    draw some cards in the same turn

content.name: Vol'jin
content.description:
Used to be a staple card in Priest in the past. It can be really good if you
                    can deal 2 damage to finish off the minion.

content.name: Confessor Paletress
content.description: One of the better inspire cards, but still dependes a lot on the RNG.

content.description: If you land this on a good 5 cost minion is already worth it.

You need to have a board and some deathrattles or end of turn effect minions to be worth it.

Lyra is one the best cards from the Un'Goro set that synergiszs well with Radiant

The discover effect is really nice but the main purpose for running this card

content.description: So you wanna go to fatigue? I think you don't.

content.name: Shadow Essence

Mainly used in Big Priest but it's also good if you land it on

content.name: Kabal Courier

Shadowstep can be used in many different ways. From burst damage if you

It requires your opponent to have at least two minions but is not

content.description: A meme card or a counter to Highlander decks in Wild.

content.name: Headcrack
content.description: You can basically use it as a Hunter hero power for 3 mana if you played a card previously this turn. Not so good...

content.name: Anub'arak
content.description: If rogue had survivability this card would be really good.

content.name: Shadowcaster
content.description: Maybe the best meme generator in the game. It also not that bad.

content.name: Deathknight
content.description: Survive one extra turn and gain continuous value in the following turns for 9 mana.

content.name: Spectral Pillager
content.description: A bad card mainly used in one turn kill decks.

content.name: Sonya Shadowdancer

content.description: A smaller and better Thistle Tea altogether.

content.description:
With this card you trade tempo for value. By that i mean that you give your opponent tempo (or combo opportunities) with the coins and
                    you get value with the spell you get. At worst it is a 6 mana 5/8.

content.name: Lotus Agents
content.description: A decent card that can fit in any deck due to the discover effect.

content.name: Lotus Assassin
content.description: Decent stats for the mana cost and a great board control card. Difficult to find a decent Rogue deck to fit this in.

content.name: Elven Minstrel

content.description:
Shaku is a really good card in midrange and tempo decks. It is

content.name: Hallucination

content.name: Reincarnate
content.description: Reincarnate can be used as a heal, or as a proc for a powerful deathrattle.

content.name: Charged Hammer
content.description: A slow weapon that upgrades your hero power if you don't care about totems.

content.name: Mistcaller
content.description: A reaaaaly slow Prince Keleseth that allows you to play 2 drops. Not good enough.

content.name: Neptulon
content.description: Neptulon has really good synergy in a murloc deck but can easily stand on it's own.

content.name: Hallazeal the Ascended
content.description:
It is as it looks. Insane card in the right moment. Average most
      of the times.

content.name: Deathknight
content.description:
Probably a downgrade for your hero power in non evolve shaman decks but

The dream is to evolve a 0 or 1 mana minion to a Sorcerer's Apprentice.

content.name: Runespear

It is good if you roll spells that don't need a target like damage aoe's

content.name: Hammer of Twilight

A 4/2 weapon for 5 mana is not great but the 4/2 elemental makes it appealing.
       Also note that you can choose when to summon the minion and dodge AOE.

content.name: Lotus Agents
content.description: A decent card that can fit in any deck due to the discover effect.

content.name: White Eyes
content.description:
A decent card by it's own that shines with deathrattle effects or when
       you draw the 5 mana 10/10 the next turn.

content.name: Ancestral Knowledge
content.description: Shaman doesn't have a lot card draw, so a 4 mana draw 2 cards with overload synergy is ok.

content.name: Cryostasis
content.description: Yeah, sorry about that.

content.name: Murmuring Elemental
content.description:
It can enable some interesting combos with Emperor Thaurissan. It's 
      still ok along with a powerful battlecry.

content.name: Finders Keepers
content.description: Overload cards tend to be powerful so you'll most likely find something useful out of this.

content.name: Summoning Portal
content.description: Can be considered as a meme card. Don't underestimate it though, cost reduction cards can win you the game.

content.name: Floating Watcher
content.description: Floating watcher was a self damage card, way before it became mainstream with Kobolds and Catacombs.

content.name: Corruption
content.description: Oh Jesus...

content.name: Dreadsteed
content.description: Dreadsteed is a card that provides you infinite value until your opponent silences it. In the other hand, the stats are not good and the mana cost is high.

content.name: Void Crusher
content.description: Oh man, warlocks have really weird cards.

content.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
content.description: Oh man, warlocks have really weird cards.

content.name: Twisting Nether
content.description: When everything else fails you can count on twisting nether. If you are still alive on turn 8.

content.name: Lord Jaraxxus
content.description: One of the most fun cards in Hearthstone that inspired the Deathknight cards.

content.name: Curse of Rafaam
content.description: It's not really good. Maybe with Nozdormu it could be decent (not really).

content.name: Deathknight
content.description: The most expensive deathknight that usually wins you the game when played.

content.name: Rin

A interesting card that has ok stats for the cost and has deathrattle synergy.
       It gives you something to play the following turns and can win you the game in control or
        fatigue matchups.

content.name: Kabal Trafficker
content.description: An average value card with random outcomes.

content.name: Bane of Doom
content.description: Not a very good card on average but can swing the game if you roll high.

content.name: Chittering Tunneler
content.description: Chittering tunneler is a mediocre value card.

content.name: Kabal Courier
content.description: Kabal Courier has a weak statline but it's battlecry is powerful because it lets you choose cards not designed for your class. It's also a discover effect meaning that you can choose what you need most, at the time.

content.name: Dark Peddler
content.description: One of the best Warlock cards ever printed.

content.name: Axe Flinger
content.description: Weak stats for the cost but synergizes well with self damage spells and battelcries.

content.name: Magnataur Alpha
content.description: A bad Cave Hydra for Warrior.

content.name: Varian Wrynn

content.name: Grommash Hellscream
content.description: It is used mainly as burst damage by the Warrior. It can also value trade with smaller minions. Remember Azure Drake?

content.name: Explore Un'Goro
content.description: Have you explored the Un'Goro yet? Pack your things and get ready for some memes.

content.name: Deathknight
content.description: An interesting deathknight with an insane AOE weapon. The hero power is useful in decks that benefit from damaged minions. It's also a free AOE every turn.

content.name: Blood Warriors
content.description: It can be used as a mediocre value card or in an Arcane Giant deck where you fill the board with giants. You know, a typical Dog deck.

content.name: King Mosh
content.description:
King mosh is an expensive mass execute that comes with a big body. 
      It's a good card even if you kill one minion.

content.name: Geosculptor Yip
content.description: A powerful end of turn effect for 8 mana that can snowball the game.

content.name: Gorehowl
content.description: Gorehowl is card that can generate you insane value if you have enough survivability. But it's really weak to weapon removal.

content.name: Malkorok
content.description: Cursed blade PTSD.

content.name: Grimy Gadgeteer
content.description: If you think of it as a delayed 4 mana 6/5 it's not bad.

content.name: Molten Blade
content.description: The first decent weapon you get that is also relevant to the situation, you use it. Or wait for Gorehowl in a control matchup

content.name: I Know a Guy
content.description: You pay 1 extra mana to discover a taunt minion. Why don't you just include the taunt minion you want?

content.name: Recombobulator
content.description: Decent stats for a 2 drop as a tempo play on turn 2 and a powerful ability that can 'heal' your minion after value trading.

content.name: Alarm-o-Bot
content.description: An extremelly situational card that if it sticks for a turn allows you to cheat the curve.

content.name: Enhance-o Mechano
content.description:
A card that is useful only if you have a board. It can be an one turn kill if you 
        have big minions or infinite value board in flood decks. Definitely a 'win more' card.

content.name: Gazlowe
content.description:
A value card suited for mech decks due to spare parts, or for classes that take  
        advantage of the cheap spells. Definitely an above average legendary.

content.name: Kel'Thuzad
content.description:
An insane value - tempo card that lets you trade your board and get a new one each turn. 
        It is difficult to kill and if it sticks you win the game. It requires you to have 
        at least one valuable minion.

content.name: Chromaggus
content.description:
Chromaggus is a really fun and valuable minion that synergizes with classes that have 
        cheap draw. It's a really expensive combo to pull though and if you don't draw at least 
        two times or the correct cards, it is a waste of tempo.

content.name: Majordomo
content.description:
The ability of Majordomo Executus seems more like a bad thing than good. 
         Can you make something out of it?

content.name: Malygos
content.description:
Unlimited burst if it survives for a turn. Emperor Thaurissan makes it 
        possible to one turn kill your opponent the turn you play him. 
        Decent body even if he gets silenced.

content.name: Auctioneer
content.description:
Infinite cycle through your deck if you protect him. Suitable for rogues and 
        combo decks that need their combo pieces fast. Can you make it until the turn he gets played?

content.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
content.description:
A big threat that needs to be played after your opponent used big game hunter. 
        It begs for hard removal. If not removed you can push some damage with him or with the 
        leper gnomes he spanws.

content.name: Nozdormu
content.description: Play it last in a complicated board and quickly hit the end turn button.

content.name: Deathwing
content.description:
An insane board clear - tempo card suited for fatigue decks. The downsides? 
        You will most likely discard useful cards and it will get killed by big game 
        hunter or hard removal.

content.name: Explosive Sheep
content.description: Depending on the class is a common consecration. Yeah.

content.name: Wild Pyromancer
content.description:
An infinite board clear in the right class. A unexpected and gimmicky combo enabler 
        in some others. Decent stats even if played on turn 2 for tempo.

content.name: Deathlord
content.description:
With insane stats for 3 mana, Deathlord is the epitome of the fatigue deck. 
        If you don't have the answer for what it spawns upon death though, you can easily lose the game.

content.name: Jeeves
content.description:
Suitable for fast decks that run out of cards quickly. It can also fit in mech 
        or hobgoblin decks.

content.name: Violet Teacher
content.description:
A card that synergizes well with cheap spells. If not removed it can flood the board 
        with 1/1 tokens. Decent stats due to 5 health.

content.name: Faceless Manipulator
content.description:
Faceless is useful for burst combos and if you or your opponent runs big minions. 
        In a fast meta if you dont run big taunts it's useless.

content.name: Blingtron 3000
content.description:
Weak stats for 4 mana minion and RNG based. You can combo it with Acidic Swamp Ooze, 
        Harrison Jones, water elementals to negate the RNG effect.

content.name: Doomsayer
content.description:
A board clear in freeze mages, behind taunts and a way to skip you opponent's early turns. 
        Weak to silence but oddly enough a decent body for buffs after silence.

content.name: Double Mind Control
content.description:
An arena dilemma (do i play around it?) and a tech card that punishes your opponent for 
        flooding the board or being ahead. Your can combo him with Brann Bronzebeard and Hungry Dragon.

content.name: Brewmasters
content.description:
Brewmasters are value based minions that have ok stats for their cost. They are useful 
        if you run valuable battlecries or want to mill your opponent with Coldlight Oracle.

content.name: Fel Reaver
content.description:
A aggresive big threat that comes on turn 5 (if you are not a Druid) and wants to go face 
        in order to end the game quickly. That is because the opponent will mill your deck 
        in a few turns with Fel Reaver on the board. Another downside is that it gets killed 
        by big game hunter.

content.name: Leeroy
content.description:
A card suited for one turn kill or super aggresive decks. The battlecry is a big 
        disadvantage if you play him without having lethal.

content.name: Hogger
content.description:
Hogger is a value card that if sticks in the board can flood it with small taunts 
        and protect you from lethal damage. The stats are too weak for the mana cost.

content.name: Illidan Stormrage
content.description: An infinite value card that is a demon but with terrible stat distribution.

content.name: Eydis - Fjola
content.description:
Legendary spider tanks. Meaning top tier stats for the cost. Their abilities are 
        powerful if you run a lot of buffs.

content.name: Fencing Coach
content.description: Weak stats for the cost but it can be a combo enabler for inspire decks.

content.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
content.description:
This is a fun value card that fits in control - fatigue decks. The random spells are 
        usually ok and sometimes can win you the game. The downside is that it is really slow.

content.name: Mukla's Champion
content.description:
Mukla's Champion is a headache for your opponent if you have a big board and he 
        doen't have removal. You must ask yourself how ofter does this happens?

content.name: Bolf Ramshield
content.description: Hmm, if you make something good from him you are a master deck builder for sure.

content.name: Kodorider
content.description:
Another value inspire card that spawn 3/5. It is definitely slow and the 3/5 stats 
        don't seem to make an impact when you play it.

content.name: Justicar Trueheart
content.description: A card that can make your hero power dreadful. Useful in control fatigue or inspire decks.

content.name: Sideshow Spelleater
content.description: Good if you don't draw the card you should be playing, Sir Finley Mrrgglton.

content.name: Icehowl
content.description:
A hard removal that can remove a threat and be on the board to remove another creature. 
        It can't go face unless you silence it.

content.name: Common Bombs
content.description:
As bomb in Hearthstone we refer to a big threat. Usualy those cards are legendary minions 
        so you can't have more than one in your deck. TGT though introduced a decent one, the 
        North Sea Kraken. Alongside the Force-Tank MAX you may be able to make something happen.

content.name: Onyxia
content.description:
One advantage of having this card is that it developes a big threat and in the same time 
        the opponent must have a board clear. Onyxia is a really good threat if your class takes 
        advantage of having minions on board. Some classes like Warrior though can remove it easily.

content.name: Ysera
content.description:
Ysera is the ultimate value card that can win you the game if it sticks more than one turn 
        or you get the dream card you want. It has really good stats even silenced. 
        The disadvantages? It is slow and it's painful if your opponent can steal it from you 
        (e.g. by killing their own Sylvanas).

content.name: Brann Bronzebeard
content.description:
Brann has decent stats to battle aggresive minions on turn 3 and in the same time 
        can compliment battlecry cards for tempo or value.

content.name: Sir Finley Mrrgglton
content.description:
A decent 1 drop for every class that enables you to play an archetype not suited 
        for your class and hero power. Control Rogue with Armor up anyone?

content.name: Elise Starseeker
content.description:
Elise Starseeker is card suited for fatigue decks that can transform your low 
        value cards into legendaries. In most matchups though you will not be able to pull 
        that combo. Another disadvantage is that you may lose valuable spells after playing the monkey.

content.name: Summoning Stone
content.description:
Summoning stone is a card that requires you to build a deck around it. The six health 
        can absorb a lot of resources if you play it on an empty board and if it sticks the 
        tempo is insane.

content.name: Arch-Thief Rafaam
content.description:
It is definitely an end game value card just like Ysera. The card you get is better 
        but only one and the stats are not that great because it can be killed by hard removal.

content.name: Hogger, Doom of Elwynn
content.description:
A card that synergizes well with classes like Warrior that can damage it to spawn
                        more minions. The 2/2's with taunt are not that great but keep in mind that make
                        killing hogger only with minions really hard. Six health is good because 
                        it is generally hard to remove it with one hit or spell

content.name: Soggoth the Slitherer
content.description:
A really big taunt that can keep you alive and dies only by minion damage 
                        and spells that don't require a target. It has good synergy with Y'Shaarj.

content.name: Blood of The Ancient One
content.description:
Lets be honest, this card is mainly for memes. The thing is that even
                        if you pull out the combo and summon a 30/30 it is not always enough to 
                        win you the game.

content.name: Moroes
content.description: A slow card that can generate value over time. It is better in a slow token deck.

content.name: Barnes
content.description:
One of the best and most frustrating cards to play against because of the
                        random outcomes. It is good if you have minions with end of turn effects 
                        like Ysera or minions with powerful dethrattles.

content.name: Medivh
content.description:
A slow control card that is vulnerable to weapon removal and has synergy
                        with big spells. If the weapon sticks it can generate you a lot of value.

content.name: Auctionmaster Beardo
content.description:
This card has good stats for its cost, but that is not enough for seeing 
                        competitive play. It can be justified if you hero power generates a lot
                        of value.

content.name: Genzo, the Shark
content.description: An aggressive card that fits in decks that can empty their hand quickly.

content.name: Burgly Bully
content.description:
The six health makes it hard to remove only with minions and if you use
                        spells the opponent gets coins. Good in decks that can benefit from coins.

content.name: Finja
content.description:
It seems that you will add some powerful murlocs in your deck. 
                        It is a powerful card for sure.

content.name: Mayor Noggenfogger
content.description:
Ehm, yes.. I don't know about that. You will have to come up with
                        something ridiculous

content.name: Prince Malchezaar
content.description:
Not a really powerful card because of the random outcome but one that
                        fits well in fatigue decks and can generate value in long battles.

content.name: Patches
content.description:
Arguably the most powerful card in Hearthstone ... until it got nerfed. 
      Before the nerf you didn't have to built a deck full of pirates even a good one was enough.
      Now that's not longer the case. Still good though in pirate or token decks.

content.name: Weasel
content.description:
Don't underestimate the meme potential of the card. Seriously though,
                        if you suffle enough of these in your opponenet's deck it can
                        disrupt some combos.

content.name: Umbra
content.description:
Umbra is a card that can't be played on curve due to the weak statline.
      You should combo it with some decent deathrattles like Mistress of Mixtures, if you need
      the heal of course. Or you can combo it with powerful deathrattle likes the Carvivorous
      Cube for some sweet value.

content.name: Elise
content.description:
Just like her alter ego (Elise the Starseeker), Elise the Trailblazer has 
      good stats for the mana cost and it's a value card. In drawned out games can provide you
      a lot of fuel to end the game.

content.name: The Voraxx
content.description: Weak stats for the cost that needs to be combo'd with good buffs.

content.name: Tortollan Primalist
content.description:
If your class have good spells that don't require a target, you may consider
      it as an option. But not really, it's not good.

content.name: Lich King
content.description:
Did you miss those really good neutral legendaries that you could put 
      in many different decks like Sylvanas and Ragnaros? Well, the Lich King is exactly that.

content.name: Drakkari Enchanter
content.description:
The stats are not good but the 5 health is not the worst. It's good if 
      you have some good end of turn effects or combo it with Master Oakheart and Dragonhatcher.

content.name: Corpsetaker
content.description: A good 4 drop if you manage to give it at least 3 out of 4 mechanics.

content.name: Nerubian Unraveler
content.description:
Some mana disruption cards after Loatheb went to Wild! It's not on 
      the same power level though.

content.name: Marin
content.description:
A win more card that fits in slow decks and can make you games memorable.
      Most of the times you will not get the chance to play it.

content.name: The Darkness
content.description:
You pay 4 mana to disable the Highlander cards of your opponent for a while. 
      You may also summon a 20/20 sometime that your opponent will most likely remove.

content.name: King Togwaggle
content.description:
The deck i just suggested you will most likely suck. So King Togwaggle
      is the best card you could have.

content.name: Arcane Tyrant
content.description:
A really good card that can be a 0 mana 4/4 in decks with good expensive spells.
      It rewards you for playing slow expensive spells, what more can you ask from the Hearthstone designers?
      Probably to nerf the Ultimate Infestation.

content.name: Sneaky Devil
content.description:
These kind of cards are dangerous for the game. Except if they cost 4 mana
      and they suck.

content.name: Feral Gibberer
content.description: An interesting card that can become dangerous if you don't remove the first one.

content.name: Kobold Monk
content.description: Heal 6 life for 4 mana, but what if you give it stealth?

content.name: Shimmering Courser
content.description:
A card that needs to be played in deck with a lot of buffs. Not that
      great even there.

content.name: Zola the Gorgon
content.description: Zola is probably a better Youthful Brewmaster.

content.name: Savagery
content.description:
Basically remove a minion with a spell like Claw or Savage Roar and then remove another one 
        for 1 mana (Savagery).

content.name: Savagery
content.description:
Basically remove a minion with a spell like Claw or Savage Roar and then remove another one 
      for 1 mana (Savagery).

content.name: Ramp
content.description: Druid has the unique ability to cheat the curve with cards like Wild Growth and Innervate.

content.name: Heal
content.description: Druid has some decent heal spells like Healing Touch and Tree of Life. Heal baby heal.

content.name: Poison Seeds
content.description:
Can be used as mass a polymorph or can upgrade your 1/1 and trigger their
      deathrattles. You will probably want to do both.

content.name: Costs(x) less
content.description:
Blackrock mountain expansion introduced cards that get cheeper while minions
      die and they are in your hand. Can be played for a swing turn.

content.name: Tree of Life
content.description:
A bad card that in the best case scenario can be used as a Reno Jackson and
      a full heal for your big minions.

content.name: Taunt
content.description:
Taunt minions generally have poor stats for their cost and leave you behind in tempo. 
      Their advantage is that they can keep you alive against aggresive decks or force bad trades.

content.name: Beast
content.description:
This archetype is mostly suited for Druid and Hunter. Other than that, there are 
      powerful common beasts that let you build a decent deck if you want to be gimmicky.

content.name: Beast
content.description:
This archetype is mostly suited for Druid and Hunter. Other than that, there are 
      powerful common beasts that let you build a decent deck if you want to be gimmicky.

content.name: Astral Communion
content.description:
A powerful card that leaves behind in tempo but allows you to play only big 
      minions. It's good if you have card draw.

content.name: Soul of the Forest
content.description:
It's a mass buff for your minion that is suited for token decks. 
      The catch here is that doesn't make your board more threating but more resistant to AOE damage.

content.name: Aviana
content.description:
A really good card that can either be a 1 mana 5/5 at turn 10,
                          or a combo enabler especially if you combine it with Kun.

content.name: Choose both!
content.description:
Obviously Fandral is the card that makes this deck theme possible. 
                          Almost every competitive Druid deck makes use of this theme.

content.name: Jade
content.description:
There is already a well defined Jade Druid deck, but you may
                          come up with something better.

content.name: Token
content.description:
Druid no matter the expansion it seems he can always built a
                          decent token deck.

content.name: Pilfered Power
content.description:
This card wants you to have a weird game plan. You want to have some
                          early game token style minions, play the card and then because of the
                          quick ramp play late game minions. Not a very solid strategy.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
Cards like Cursed Disciple and Giant Anaconda make the completion of this
      quest easier. You'll probably need card after that.

content.name: Hadronox
content.description: It's a slow card but the effect is comparable to N'Zoth or Bloodreaver Gul'dan

content.name: Recruit
content.description:
Druid has a recruit theme centered around 4 cost minions. Can be used in 
      many different ways.

content.name: Armor
content.description:
Druid was always the second armor class after Warrior but now he got a 
      lot of extra tools and can be considered as the class that utilizes armor the most.

content.name: Buff
content.description:
This theme allows you to transform regular minions into big threats.
      The bad thing is that you must always have a minion on the board.

content.name: Buff
content.description:
This theme allows you to transform regular minions into big threats.
      The bad thing is that you must always have a minion on the board.

content.name: Druids
content.description: Inception.

content.name: Ancient
content.description: In this theme you'll find really old guys and trees.

content.name: Pirate
content.description:
Pirate is a minion tag that is not as expensive as others, meaning that
      they usually have good stats for their mana cost. If play a class with weapons or throw
       patches in, you have a decent deck.

content.name: Feign Death
content.description:
A powerful effect that requires you to build a deck around deathrattle minions.
      Not a really good card if you don't have a board.

content.name: Secret
content.description:
Secrets in Hunter cost 2 mana and are a staple in any Hunter deck because of
       the Eaglehorn Bow.

content.name: Weapon
content.description:
Weapons are mainly considered as tempo removals if you have the life to 
      spare. Other weapons can have unique, deck defining effects but in this case they lose you 
      tempo.

content.name: Empty hand
content.description:
The title is self explanatory. You play your hand quickly and get some
      extra benefits.

content.name: Call Pet
content.description:
The cost reduction can enable some sweet combos. To be worth it you need
      at least half your deck to be beasts and especially high cost beasts.

content.name: Beast
content.description:
This archetype is mostly suited for Druid and Hunter. Other than that, there are 
      powerful common beasts that let you build a decent deck if you want to be gimmicky.

content.name: Lock and Load
content.description: A theme that has a lot of meme potential.

content.name: Ball of Spiders
content.description: A bad value card.

content.name: Handbuff
content.description:
Many handbuff cards seem good on paper but in practice they are too slow.
      In addition they may land in the wrong minions or you maybe don't have any minios in
      your hand.

content.name: Stampede
content.description: It's similar to Lock and Load. They are both used in meme decks.

content.name: Quest
content.description: A mediocre quest.

content.name: Professor Putricide
content.description:
Has potential, but keep in mind that he you could give a quest you intend
      to play next. Mad scientist is still better.

content.name: Spell hunter
content.description:
This theme was considered as a meme when it first came out but has
      proven that is more than that.

content.name: Recruit
content.description:
The Hunter recruit deck depends on Kathrena Winterwisp and the combos
      that brings to the table with charge minions and Carnivorous Cubes.

content.name: Secret
content.description:
The mage secrets are the most expensive in the game. And the most powerful
      of course. Blizzard was pushing this theme from the start of the game, so there are a lot
      of synergistic cards to choose from.

content.name: Freeze enemy board
content.description:
Mage has a lot of spells that can freeze your enemy's board. If your 
      are behind you can stall until you draw a board clear. If you are even or ahead you can 
      push damage for lethal.

content.name: Echo of Medivh
content.description:
A powerful card that can refil you hand if you have a board. Can be used
      with cheap minions in a flood deck or with mid-range minions in a value deck.

content.name: Minions that Freeze
content.description:
Mage has a lot of minions that freeze enemies either by hit or with an
      ability. This strategy is not solid but can be effective against weapon classes.

content.name: Burn
content.description:
Your strategy is simple. Burn your opponent with early minions or 
      spells. Mostly suited for aggressive archetypes but control archetypes (freeze mage)
      can also use it.

content.name: Spell Damage
content.description:
Wild mage has some good spell damage minions in her disposal. Combine them with
                          cheap spells and make some mess.

content.name: Duplicate - Effigy
content.description:
Your goal here is to trigger the secrets on high value minions. You'll also 
      want cards like Mad Scientist to draw the secrets.

content.name: Coldarra Drake
content.description:
This dragon has decent stats and an interesting ability. You'll most likely
      play a dragon deck and you'll want to make your hero power stronger and cheaper.

content.name: Costs(x) less
content.description:
Blackrock mountain expansion introduced cards that get cheeper while minions
      die and they are in your hand. Can be played for a swing turn.

content.name: Animated Armor
content.description:
Animated Armor has a unique ability that can save you at least 4 health.
      If you manage to hide it behind a taunt, it can save you even more. Still a bad 
      card overall.

content.name: Demented Frostcaller
content.description:
Demented Frostcaller can freeze lock your opponent's board if you 
      combine it with cheap spells. It's still a bad card though.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
It is one of the better quests that's used to kill the opponent in one turn.
      Or to be precise in two turns. It is used in control decks that try to stall the game until
      they complete the quest or draw the combo.

content.name: Elemental
content.description:
An interesting minion tag that came along with the Un'Goro expansion. Elemental
      synergistic cards require you to play an elemental on the previous turn. That makes them minion
      heavy decks that play on curve.

content.name: Minion copy
content.description:
The goal here is to copy our minions because they are awesome! If the
       minions cost more than the cards that copy, we are good.

content.name: Big Spell
content.description:
With Dragon's Fury, Mage can easily play a deck that is full of AOE. Raven
      Familiar helps with card draw and Dragoncaller Alanna closes out games.

content.name: Not from deck
content.description:
Mage with Leyline Manipulator can have some tempo plays with the random cards
      she generates from Cabalist Tome or similar cards.

content.name: Spellstone
content.description:
The Mage spellstone pushes further the elemental theme on the class. Leyline
      Manipulator can generate some tempo in a crazy theme that can create explosive turns. 
      It's not very consistent and it's hard to set up those explosive turns.

content.name: Glacial Mysteries
content.description:
One may think that if this card pull out 3 secrets you are fine. The bad
      thing is that Mage secrets don't synergise well together.

content.name: Kabal
content.description:
Kabal family specializes in magic. They are value minions that generate you 
      card advantage. They can also give you cards from other classes.

content.name: Pirate
content.description:
Pirate is a minion tag that is not as expensive as others, meaning that
      they usually have good stats for their mana cost. If play a class with weapons or throw
       patches in, you have a decent deck.

content.name: Heal
content.description:
Paladin is one of the classes that can heal effectively. Not a 
       very effective strategy for aggressive decks.

content.name: Weapon
content.description:
Weapons are mainly considered as tempo removals if you have the life to 
      spare. Other weapons can have unique, deck defining effects but in this case they lose you 
      tempo.

content.name: Secret
content.description:
Paladin has the cheapest secrets in the game. A secret Paladin deck
       used to be the best deck in the game due to the power level of Avenge and 
       Mysterious Challenger.

content.name: Holy Wrath
content.description:
Not a vary solid strategy. Your goal is to use it, draw a molten giant 
      and deal 25 damage out of nowhere.

content.name: Weapon
content.description:
Weapons are mainly considered as tempo removals if you have the life to 
      spare. Other weapons can have unique, deck defining effects but in this case they lose you 
      tempo.

content.name: 1 attack
content.description:
Paladin has a lot of cards that neutralize your opponent's minions. If 
      combo'd with a Stampeding Kodo can be also be used as hard removal.

content.name: Blessed Champion
content.description:
A combo theme that wants to deal a lot of damage to the 
      opponent in one turn.

content.name: Silver Hand Recruit
content.description:
A theme that synergises with the Paladin hero power. The wild version
      is much stronger.

content.name: Divine Shield
content.description:
Just like taunt minions they have poor stats but they can 2 for 1 if played the right moment. 
      They get a lot of value in buff - board control decks. Also don't forget that you can 
      develop early in the game a big threat like Blood Knight.

content.name: Divine Shield
content.description:
Just like taunt minions they have poor stats but they can 2 for 1 if played the right moment. 
      They get a lot of value in buff - board control decks. Also don't forget that you can 
      develop early in the game a big threat like Blood Knight.

content.name: Costs(x) less
content.description:
Blackrock mountain expansion introduced cards that get cheeper while minions
      die and they are in your hand. Can be played for a swing turn.

content.name: Reduce to 1 health
content.description:
The compination of Wild Pyromacer + Equality or Equality + Consecration are
      two of most effective board clears in the game.

content.name: Mysterious Challenger
content.description:
This card used to be one of the most broken cards in Hearthstone due to
      Avenge and cards like Muster for Battle and Shielded Minibot.

content.name: Anyfin Can Happen
content.description:
You can use this card as a powerful combo in a control deck or 
      as a board refil in a Murloc deck.

content.name: Steward of Darkshire
content.description:
A theme that synergises well with the Paladin hero power or the 
      Silver Hand Recruit theme.

content.name: Murloc
content.description:
The most synergistic minion tag in the game. This can lead to a ridiculous early 
      victory if the opponent has no answers but more likely than that, there were not be 
      enough murlocs in the board for you to win. Paladin, Shaman and Warlock have some extra cards 
      in their arsenal if they choose to build a deck around Murlocs.

content.name: Handbuff
content.description:
Many handbuff cards seem good on paper but in practice they are too slow.
      In addition they may land in the wrong minions or you maybe don't have any minios in
      your hand.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
One of the worst quests but let's be honest. Who doesn't want to
      summon Galvadon?

content.name: Silver Hand Recruit
content.description:
A theme that synergises with the Paladin hero power. The wild version
      is much stronger.

content.name: Recruit
content.description:
Paladin has arguably the best recruit card, Call to Arms. It fills your
      board, it's too good for 4 mana and also thins your deck, so you can have better top decks.

content.name: Buff
content.description:
This theme allows you to transform regular minions into big threats.
      The bad thing is that you must always have a minion on the board.

content.name: Buff
content.description:
This theme allows you to transform regular minions into big threats.
      The bad thing is that you must always have a minion on the board.

content.name: Inner Fire
content.description:
One really old theme that is regularly used in competitive decks. You want
      to stick a big health minion on the board, buff it and kill your opponent.

content.name: Resurrect
content.description:
Your goal here is to play powerful minions and bring them back to life
      efficiently, with spells like resurrect and minions like Onyx Bishop.

content.name: Silence
content.description:
Weak stats for their cost but sometimes by silencing the right target can net you 
      a big advantage and relief.

content.name: Steal
content.description: Yeah, in Hearthstone the Priests steal and the Rogues perform miracles. Get over it.

content.name: Burn
content.description:
Your strategy is simple. Burn your opponent with early minions or spells. Mostly suited for aggressive archetypes but control archetypes (freeze mage)
      can also use it.

content.name: Lightbomb
content.description:
Lightbomb is an extremely effective AOE that is really hard to play around.
      You can build your deck to take advantage of Lightbomb by adding high health minions.

content.name: Heal
content.description:
Priest is obviously the best heal class in the game. When your opponent
      thinks your are finished, you bounce back with cards like Greater Healing Potion and extend
       the game for one more turn.

content.name: Heal to damage
content.description:
Priest has a lot of effective healing. But with cards like Auchenai
       Soulpriest it's possible to turn this healing into damage, which is unfair.

content.name: Heal synergies
content.description:
Priest has a vast amount of healing options and a lot of cards
       that take advantage of that.

content.name: Plus health
content.description:
This is a buff deck for Priest. Your goal is to stick a minion
      on the board and buff it. You can take trades or cast Inner Fire and go face.

content.name: Plus health
content.description:
This is a buff deck for Priest. Your goal is to stick a minion
      on the board and buff it. You can take trades or cast Inner Fire and go face.

content.name: Silence benefits minions
content.description:
In this theme you can negate the downsides of some minions by silencing them 
        or by giving them taunt.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
The Priest quest requires you to play a bunch of deathrattle minions.
       The reward is Amara that has a Reno like effect. You can also go full meme and play weasel.

content.name: Big Priest
content.description:
A powerful theme that tries to summon powerful minions with Barnes and
       bring them back to life with Eternal Servitude or the Spellstone.

content.name: Dragon Soul
content.description:
Dragon Soul is a weak weapon with a promising effect. If you can spawn some
      early game dragons or combine it with Lyra, you'll have a good time.

content.name: Temporus
content.description:
A powerful effect not only for you but for your opponent also. It
       is mainly for the memes.

content.name: Twilight's Call
content.description:
This card is mainly used in quest decks. You can use it early game with 
      Loot Hoarder and Bloodmage Thalnos to draw some cards or late game with high value 
      deathrattle minions.

content.name: Twilight
content.description: Oh man those movies suck.

content.name: Kabal
content.description:
Kabal family specializes in magic. They are value minions that generate you 
      card advantage. They can also give you cards from other classes.

content.name: Pirate
content.description:
Pirate is a minion tag that is not as expensive as others, meaning that
      they usually have good stats for their mana cost. If play a class with weapons or throw
       patches in, you have a decent deck.

content.name: Stealth
content.description:
Stealth minions have ok stats for their cost and because of their ability 
      you can choose where they attack which is very useful. Because of the stealth 
      they are also excellent in buff decks. Be careful though to not play them into a board clear.

content.name: Stealth
content.description:
Stealth minions have ok stats for their cost and because of their ability 
      you can choose where they attack which is very useful. Because of the stealth 
      they are also excellent in buff decks. Be careful though to not play them into a board clear.

content.name: Weapon
content.description:
Weapons are mainly considered as tempo removals if you have the life to 
      spare. Other weapons can have unique, deck defining effects but in this case they lose you 
      tempo.

content.name: Weapon
content.description:
Weapons are mainly considered as tempo removals if you have the life to 
      spare. Other weapons can have unique, deck defining effects but in this case they lose you 
      tempo.

content.name: Oil
content.description:
Tinker's Sharpsword Oil used to be an insane card in combination with
      the unerfed Blade Flurry. Nowdays can be used as burst card with cheap charge minions or
       to buff Kingsbane.

content.name: Burn
content.description:
Your strategy is simple. Burn your opponent with early minions or 
      spells. Mostly suited for aggressive archetypes but control archetypes (freeze mage)
      can also use it.

content.name: Sap spells
content.description:
Sap spells are the epitome of tempo. They neutralize threats for a turn or
      two and allow you to end the game or extend it until you draw your combo.

content.name: Combo text
content.description:
Combo is a core mechanic of the Rogue class. They cost less, but require you 
      to play other cards first. That's why coin is important for Rogue. Cheap spells like 
      Shadowstep and Preparation also help.

content.name: Burgle
content.description: Rogues oddly enough, are good in stealing stuff.

content.name: Deathrattle
content.description:
They usually have insane stats for their mana cost value wise. They are not good tempo plays 
      but they stick in the board. With cards like Kel'Thuzad, Baron Rivedare or N'Zoth 
      they can quickly go out of control.

content.name: Deathrattle
content.description:
They usually have insane stats for their mana cost value wise. They are not good tempo plays 
      but they stick in the board. With cards like Kel'Thuzad, Baron Rivedare or N'Zoth 
      they can quickly go out of control.

content.name: Miracle
content.description:
One of the oldest decks for the Rogue class, that tries to cycle through
      the deck with Gadgetzan Auctioneer and end the game with burst. It's weak when you 
      dont draw the Auctioneer in time.

content.name: More than 2 copies of a card
content.description: Imagine a deck with 8 backstabs! Oh wait.

content.name: Jade
content.description:
The Rogue Jade deck is not on the same power level as the Druid one, but still
      is a solid deck. You can combine it with some deathrattle cards.

content.name: Non rogue cards
content.description:
The game plan is simple. You steal cards from your opponent and when
                          you have stolen enough you play Ethereal Peddler to make them cheap.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
The best quest before the nerf is nowdays a fun deck that punishes slow decks. 
      Sonya Shadowdancer with charge minions can help you complete the quest faster.

content.name: Flower
content.description: They may seem beautiful at first glance but don't let them fool you!

content.name: Kingsbane
content.description:
One of the best weapons from Kobolds and Catacombs expansion that is not 
      vulnerable to weapon destruction. The most common archetype that uses this card is a mill
      deck.

content.name: Secret
content.description:
In Kobolds and Catacombs Rogue became the fourth class in Hearthstone that
      uses secrets. They are interesting cards but there is not enough synergy yet.

content.name: Pirate
content.description:
Pirate is a minion tag that is not as expensive as others, meaning that
      they usually have good stats for their mana cost. If play a class with weapons or throw
       patches in, you have a decent deck.

content.name: Weapon
content.description:
Weapons are mainly considered as tempo removals if you have the life to 
      spare. Other weapons can have unique, deck defining effects but in this case they lose you 
      tempo.

content.name: Totem
content.description:
Totem Shaman is a token deck that tries to fill the board with small minions
      and burst the opponent with Bloodlust. It can also spawn Al'akir in turn 5 with Windshear 
      Stormcaller

content.name: Bloodlust
content.description:
In this theme you'll want to flood the board with cheap minions and burst 
      your opponent with Bloodlust.

content.name: Bloodlust
content.description:
In this theme you'll want to flood the board with cheap minions and burst 
      your opponent with Bloodlust.

content.name: Windfury
content.description:
A high health minion with windfury can easily trade 2 for 1 with smaller minions 
      but in most cases you will use the ability for pressure or lethal damage.

content.name: Lava Shock (Overload)
content.description:
Overload is a core mechanic in Shaman. It allows you to have some explosive 
      tempo turns in the expense of the following turn. If you include cards that synergise well
       with Overloard and plan your turns carefully you'll be successful.

content.name: Ancestor's Call
content.description:
You'll want to run this card in a contol deck with Malygos and
      burst spells. If you have the hard removal you can play it in deck with expensive
      minions also.

content.name: Burn
content.description:
Your strategy is simple. Burn your opponent with early minions or 
      spells. Mostly suited for aggressive archetypes but control archetypes (freeze mage)
      can also use it.

content.name: Heal
content.description:
Shaman didn't start as a class that could heal but over the years 
      got some sweet heal cards.

content.name: Heal
content.description:
Shaman didn't start as a class that could heal but over the years 
      got some sweet heal cards.

content.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
content.description:
Thunder Bluff Valiant can be a devasting card if you have totems on 
      board. If the opponent doesn't remove it immediately, it can snowball hard.

content.name: Battlecry
content.description:
If you want to build a deck with battlecry minions it will most likely be a minion 
      based deck because most of the good battlecries require to have minions in play 
      in order to be good. They can also remove enemy minions while developing a minion, 
      allowing you some tempo plays. With Crowd Favorite introduced in TGT we also 
      have some synergy.

content.name: Everyfin is Awesome
content.description:
A mass buff card that can be effective if you have murlocs on the board.
       It has really good synergy with the Call in the Finishers.

content.name: Evolve
content.description:
Evolve is a recent RNG based theme for Shaman. It has seen competitive
      play and it's extremely fun. In the other hand it feels really bad when the RNG gods
       have forsaken you.

content.name: Jade
content.description:
Jades are a good fit for Shaman because he can take advantage of the multiple 
      bodies on the board. The most important factor though is that the Shaman has some 
      really powerful Jade cards.

content.name: Elemental
content.description:
An interesting minion tag that came along with the Un'Goro expansion. Elemental
      synergistic cards require you to play an elemental on the previous turn. That makes them minion
      heavy decks that play on curve.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
A weak but fun quest. Cards like Call in the Finishers make the completion easier
      than it seems. Murlocs are extremelly synergistic but weak to AOE and to other aggressive 
      decks. If they stick on board you have a good chance of winning.

content.name: Spirit Echo
content.description:
Spirit Echo is not powerful card but shines when you develop a decent board 
      because it makes it durable.

content.name: Freeze
content.description:
Blizzard is trying really hard to push the freeze theme into Shaman. 
      So far it has been a disaster. It is one of the most meme decks you could play.

content.name: Windshear Stormcaller
content.description:
Windshear Stormcaller is a decent minion for the cost and a win condition 
      if you build your deck around it. Better to trigger the effect end game to take advantage
       of the extra mana.

content.name: Recruit
content.description:
Shaman doesn't have any class specific recruit cards but has a 
      really powerful 4 mana drop that can pull from Guild Recruiter.

content.name: Spellstone
content.description:
Arguably the worst spellstone in the game. You'll want to build a control deck 
      with high value cards that overload you. Earth elemental is the perfect fit here.

content.name: Demon
content.description:
Demons are weary of Warlocks because they will sacrifice them in 
      the first chance. Seriously though they are usually powerful minions with unique effects.
       Warlocks have insane synergy with them.

content.name: Demon
content.description:
Demons are weary of Warlocks because they will sacrifice them in 
      the first chance. Seriously though they are usually powerful minions with unique effects.
       Warlocks have insane synergy with them.

content.name: Demonwrath
content.description:
Demonwrath is an effective aoe that can be unfair if your decks has
       a lot of demons.

content.name: Discard
content.description:
Warlock has a lot of synergy with the discard mechanic. It's not a 
      very effective strategy because you can't choose what cards to discard. If you could it
       would be unfair.

content.name: Void terror
content.description:
Void terror is a powerful card that can be used to trigger your 
      deathrattles and develop a big body at the same turn.

content.name: Self damage
content.description:
Warlock has many minions that are too powerful for their mana cost but have
       a downside. Self damage. You'll take advantage of the tempo they offer and use cards that 
       take advantage of your decreasing life. Be careful not to die.

content.name: Voidcaller
content.description:
Voidcaller is an interesing minion that your opponent will hesitate to kill. 
      You can cheat out powerful demons like Mal'Ganis or Doomguard and overwhelm you opponent.

content.name: Renounce Darkness
content.description: Renounce Darkness is a synonym of meme.

content.name: Murloc
content.description:
The most synergistic minion tag in the game. This can lead to a ridiculous early 
      victory if the opponent has no answers but more likely than that, there were not be 
      enough murlocs in the board for you to win. Paladin, Shaman and Warlock have some extra cards 
      in their arsenal if they choose to build a deck around Murlocs.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
The Warlock quest is arguably the worst quest in the game. The reward provides 
       you a constant flow of demons on the board but the discard mechanic is not consistent 
       enough. It's not that bad if you complete it with Malchezaar's Imp and Cataclysm.

content.name: Elemental
content.description:
An interesting minion tag that came along with the Un'Goro expansion. Elemental
      synergistic cards require you to play an elemental on the previous turn. That makes them minion
      heavy decks that play on curve.

content.name: Treachery
content.description:
A really nice idea that can ruin your opponents hopes and dreams. You'll 
      want to give them a Howlfiend and proc it as many times as possible with Defile. Hopefully
       they'll discard important cards.

content.name: Man'ari
content.description:
Skull of the Man'ari is another Warlock card that synergises with Demons. It's
      weak to weapon destruction but if it stays can provide you a lot of tempo and combo
       opportunities.

content.name: Kabal
content.description:
Kabal family specializes in magic. They are value minions that generate you 
      card advantage. They can also give you cards from other classes.

content.name: Buff
content.description:
Buff Warlock decks unlike other classes can buff only Demons. Demons
      are powerful minions for their cost so they'll probably stick on the board.

content.name: Pirate
content.description:
Pirate is a minion tag that is not as expensive as others, meaning that
      they usually have good stats for their mana cost. If play a class with weapons or throw
       patches in, you have a decent deck.

content.name: Pirate
content.description:
Pirate is a minion tag that is not as expensive as others, meaning that
      they usually have good stats for their mana cost. If play a class with weapons or throw
       patches in, you have a decent deck.

content.name: Weapon
content.description:
Weapons are mainly considered as tempo removals if you have the life to 
      spare. Other weapons can have unique, deck defining effects but in this case they lose you 
      tempo.

content.name: Enrage
content.description:
Enrage mechanic is not exclusive to Warrior. But Warrior has a lot of ways to
      damage his own minions. Enrage minions offer a considerable advantage when damaged, so they
       are first priority targets.

content.name: Iron Juggernaut
content.description:
Here you'll want to shuffle as many bombs as possible in your opponent's
      deck with the help of bouncing cards like Youthful Brewmaster.

content.name: Bomber
content.description: Warrior loves to damage his own minions. So does the Bomber goblins.

content.name: Burn
content.description:
Your strategy is simple. Burn your opponent with early minions or 
      spells. Mostly suited for aggressive archetypes but control archetypes (freeze mage)
      can also use it.

content.name: Damage your minions
content.description:
Warrior has a lot of ways to damage his own minions. If you throw in some
       minions or spells that benefit from that you've got yourself a deck.

content.name: Armor synergy
content.description:
Armor synergy is a core part in Warrior decks. You have very efficient removals 
      like Shield Slam to devasting AOE's like Reckless Flurry. You can also snowball the game
       with Yip's end of turn effect.

content.name: Charge
content.description:
Charge minions can be used as slightly expensive removal available to classes 
      that don't have many removals. But in reality you will must likely use them 
      in an aggresive deck to smack your opponent's face.

content.name: Bolster
content.description:
Taunt Warrior became a meme with Bolster and later a meta deck 
      with the Quest.

content.name: Infinite Value
content.description:
Control Warriors are notorious for their ability to outvalue their opponents. 
      Cards like Dead Man's Hand go that concept a little further. To infinity.

content.name: Taunt
content.description:
Taunt minions generally have poor stats for their cost and leave you behind in tempo. 
      Their advantage is that they can keep you alive against aggresive decks or force bad trades.

content.name: Handbuff
content.description:
Many handbuff cards seem good on paper but in practice they are too slow.
      In addition they may land in the wrong minions or you maybe don't have any minios in
      your hand.

content.name: Quest
content.description:
One of the best quests, Fire Plume's Heart rewards for playing taunt minions
       with ragnaros ability. You can deal 8 damage to random minion after you destroy your
       3 cost, 4/2 weapon. Best used in slower decks.

content.name: Sudden Genesis
content.description:
Probably, you'll want to use this card with big charge minions. You 
       could also use it in a minion heavy deck to develop you board. Another option is 
       to use it with big end of turn or deathrattle minions.

content.name: Dead Man's Hand
content.description:
If you cast Dead Man's Hand while having another copy in you hand, you
       will never run out of cards. This theme as you may have guessed, is better used in 
       slower decks.

content.name: Recruit
content.description:
Recruit Warrior decks synergise well with big minions. They have no
       mana limitations like Druid recruit (4 mana), but you'll want to include some 
       expensive minions for optimal results.

content.name: Berserker
content.description: Those guys get easily mad, so be careful.

content.name: Beast
content.description:
This archetype is mostly suited for Druid and Hunter. Other than that, there are 
      powerful common beasts that let you build a decent deck if you want to be gimmicky.

content.name: Beast
content.description:
This archetype is mostly suited for Druid and Hunter. Other than that, there are 
      powerful common beasts that let you build a decent deck if you want to be gimmicky.

content.name: Dragon
content.description:
One of the biggest reasons to play a Dragon deck is Blackwing Corruptor. 
        That deck is usually slow because the good dragons are expensive minions 
        but you can go faster with cards like fiery dragon, Blackwing Corruptor and Drakonid Crusher.

content.name: Dragon
content.description:
Dragon decks no longer have insane synergistic cards like Blackwing Corruptor (except Priest). 
        They now have solid expensive cards like Primordial Drake or aggressive ones 
        like Cobalt Scalebane.

content.name: Charge
content.description:
Charge minions can be used as slightly expensive removal available to classes 
        that don't have many removals. But in reality you will must likely use them 
        in an aggresive deck to smack your opponent's face.

content.name: Charge
content.description:
Charge minions can be used as slightly expensive removal available to classes 
      that don't have many removals. But in reality you will must likely use them 
      in an aggresive deck to smack your opponent's face.

content.description:
Taunt minions generally have poor stats for their cost and leave you behind in tempo. 
      Their advantage is that they can keep you alive against aggresive decks or force bad trades.

content.name: Taunt
content.description:
Taunt minions generally have poor stats for their cost and leave you behind in tempo. 
      Their advantage is that they can keep you alive against aggresive decks or force bad trades.

content.name: Divine Shield
content.description:
Just like taunt minions they have poor stats but they can 2 for 1 if played the right moment. 
        They get a lot of value in buff - board control decks. Also don't forget that you can 
        develop early in the game a big threat like Blood Knight.

content.name: Divine Shield
content.description:
Just like taunt minions they have poor stats but they can 2 for 1 if played the right moment. 
      They get a lot of value in buff - board control decks. Also don't forget that you can 
      develop early in the game a big threat like Blood Knight.
