content.description:
They usually have insane stats for their mana cost value wise. They are not good tempo plays 
        but they stick in the board. With cards like Kel'Thuzad, Baron Rivedare or N'Zoth 
        they can quickly go out of control.

content.name: Deathrattle
content.description:
They usually have insane stats for their mana cost value wise. They are not good tempo plays 
      but they stick in the board. With cards like Kel'Thuzad, Baron Rivedare or N'Zoth 
      they can quickly go out of control.

content.name: Spell Damage
content.description:
Except Azure Drake and Bloodmage Thalnos there are not many good spellpower minions 
        but with Master of Ceremonies introduced in TGT we now have some synergy. 
        They synergize well with cheap spells.

content.name: Spell Damage
content.description:
Except Azure Drake and Bloodmage Thalnos there are not many good spellpower minions 
      but with Master of Ceremonies introduced in TGT we now have some synergy. 
      They synergize well with cheap spells.

content.name: Token
content.description:
A token deck is flood deck that wants to fill the board with sticky minions, or 
        with minions that spawn from other minions (tokens). They can be really powerful 
        if you can take advantage of a big board, protect them and refil your hand.

content.name: Token
content.description:
A token deck is flood deck that wants to fill the board with sticky minions, or 
      with minions that spawn from other minions (tokens). They can be really powerful 
      if you can take advantage of a big board, protect them and refil your hand.

content.name: Mech
content.description:
Mech decks are usually fast board centric decks that take advantage of the cost 
        reduction that the Mechwarper offers. Lately we saw value cards like Gorillabot A-3. 
        Maybe they can fit in slower decks also.

content.name: Battlecry
content.description:
If you want to build a deck with battlecry minions it will most likely be a minion 
      based deck because most of the good battlecries require to have minions in play 
      in order to be good. They can also remove enemy minions while developing a minion, 
      allowing you some tempo plays. With Crowd Favorite introduced in TGT we also 
      have some synergy.

content.name: Battlecry
content.description:
If you want to build a deck with battlecry minions it will most likely be a minion 
      based deck because most of the good battlecries require to have minions in play 
      in order to be good. They can also remove enemy minions while developing a minion, 
      allowing you some tempo plays. With Crowd Favorite introduced in TGT we also 
      have some synergy.

content.name: Stealth
content.description:
Stealth minions have ok stats for their cost and because of their ability 
      you can choose where they attack which is very useful. Because of the stealth 
      they are also excellent in buff decks. Be careful though to not play them into a board clear.

content.name: Stealth
content.description:
Stealth minions have ok stats for their cost and because of their ability 
      you can choose where they attack which is very useful. Because of the stealth 
      they are also excellent in buff decks. Be careful though to not play them into a board clear.

content.name: Murloc
content.description:
The most synergistic minion tag in the game. This can lead to a ridiculous early 
      victory if the opponent has no answers but more likely than that, there were not be 
      enough murlocs in the board for you to win. Paladin, Shaman and Warlock have some extra cards 
      in their arsenal if they choose to build a deck around Murlocs.

content.name: Windfury
content.description:
A high health minion with windfury can easily trade 2 for 1 with smaller minions 
        but in most cases you will use the ability for pressure or lethal damage.

content.name: Windfury
content.description:
A high health minion with windfury can easily trade 2 for 1 with smaller minions 
      but in most cases you will use the ability for pressure or lethal damage.

content.name: Antispell
content.description:
There are some times that you are really bored of the things the Rogues do to you. 
        Likely enough, there are some cards that can help you win against them or againest 
        other spell heavy classes.

content.name: Double BGH
content.description: No one expects a second Big Game Hunter. So it can be game winning choice in a control metagame.

content.name: Hobgoblin
content.description:
Hobgoblin can compliment 1 attack minions and can also transform your petiful minions 
        into considerable threats in the late game if you have a plan.

content.name: Counter (tech cards)
content.description:
Those cards when they hit their target they are game changers. Why not make a deck 
        with all of them to see what happens?

content.name: Feugen - Stalagg
content.description:
Feugen has really good stats for the cost but Stalagg is only good against expensive 
        minions. If they both die in the same game (not so usual) you develop a big threat with 
        a small cost.

content.name: Grim Patron
content.description: If your class has a way to deal 1 damage to the patron you can make a full board of them.

content.name: Untargetable
content.description:
Those minions can be a real headache if your opponent relies on removing your minions 
        with spells. Mage has an extra minion the Wee Spellstopper.

content.name: Ogre
content.description:
Their characteristic is that they have really good stats for their cost. 
        Their disadvantage is that they are stupid.

content.name: Giant
content.description: Giants are big 8/8 bodies that can be tempo plays if their conditions are met.

content.name: Plus attack
content.description:
The most notable combo of those battlecry minions is to buff the attack of an 
        enemy creature and then Big Game Hunter it.

content.name: Big hand
content.description: You draw cards and then play Twilight Drake and Mountain Giant on turn 4. Simple.

content.name: Inspire
content.description:
And you thought Dragon decks are slow.. Inspire decks are reaally slow and can be 
        used only in classes that have decent hero powers and not situational ones.

content.name: Joust
content.description:
If their effect hits they are really good for their cost. More likely than not 
        that wont happen though because you lose even in draw. So your deck has to be 
        heavier than your opponent's and you must trust your luck.

content.name: Silence
content.description:
Weak stats for their cost but sometimes by silencing the right target can net you 
        a big advantage and relief.

content.name: Deal damage minions
content.description: This is a subset of battlecry minions that can net you tempo when played.

content.name: Card draw
content.description:
In this theme you choose minions or spells that let you draw cards and cycle
        your deck quickly.

content.name: Silence benefits minions
content.description: In this theme you can negate the downsides of some minions by silencing or by giving them taunt.

content.name: Mana disruption
content.description: Do you feel that your opponent will have a good play next turn? Why not ruin it then?

content.name: Discover
content.description:
League of Explorers introduced this mechanic that lets you find answers that are 
        not inside your deck. It has random outcomes but at least you can choose.

content.name: Discover
content.description:
League of Explorers introduced this mechanic that lets you find answers that are 
      not inside your deck. It has random outcomes but at least you can choose.

content.name: Naga Sea Witch
content.description:
Decent stats for the cost but with an ability difficult to be useful. 
        It can be good on turn 6 if you have a 9 mana minion and your opponent 
        cant remove it or on turn 10 by developing a big threat and a 5/5. 
        In the other hand it is not good to spend 5 mana for your cheaper cards. Finally
        it's broken with Giants.

content.name: C'Thun
content.description:
Build a deck that worships this powerful Old God! You are searching for cards that
                          are not bad to grow your C'Thun and for cards that benefit from your big C'Thun.
                          If you can somehow double the battlecry effect of the C'Thun, it is unstoppable.

content.name: N'Zoth
content.description:
This Old God needs you to put some powerful deathrattle minions in your deck. 
                          Best played after a board clear to refil your board and hopefuly checkmate
                          your opponent.

content.name: Yogg
content.description:
Used to be at least a reliable board clear before the nerf, but it is still
                          strong enough. You will have to praise Yogg though.

content.name: Y'Shaarj
content.description:
An end-game card that has good synergy with big minions. It is also great
                          when pulled out of you deck with Barnes (the other way around is painful though).

content.name: Triple type syngergy!
content.description:
A theme that came out in Karazhan and benefits if your deck has dragons, murlocs
                          and beasts. Even two minion types sometimes are enough.

content.name: Hogs rock!
content.description: Really tough to make a good deck with these... Good luck!

content.name: Elemental
content.description:
An interesting minion tag that came along with the Un'Goro expansion. Elemental
      synergistic cards require you to play an elemental on the previous turn. That makes them minion
      heavy decks that play on curve.

content.name: Adapt
content.description:
Similar to the discover mechanic, adapt is also random but you can choose
      an option out of three random ones. Adapt minions are also DINOSAURS!

content.name: Hemet
content.description:
Decent body for the mana cost with a unique effect. It is not suited for
      control versus control but it's useful to thin out your deck and only draw your 
      late game cards.

content.name: Lifesteal
content.description:
Lifesteal cards are very expensive for their mana cost. They can fully heal 
      you if they stick on the board and you buff them.

content.name: Recruit
content.description:
Recruit mechanic for neutral minions is centered around 5 mana cost with
      Guild Recruiter (we have cookies!) and 8 cost minions with Silver Vanguard.

content.name: Big Spell
content.description:
Spiteful Summoner and Grand Archivist allow you to play minion heavy 
      decks with the requirement to put some expensive spells in your deck.

content.name: Master Oakheart
content.description:
Master Oakheart can pull out some really powerful combo's. The most popular,
      is the one listed here with Drakkari Enchanter and Dragonhatcher.

content.name: Minions w downsides
content.description:
These are minions that have much better stats for their mana cost but they
      come with a downside. If you can play around those downsides they are worth it.
